title: John Mitten
text:
John Mitten (born 30 March 1941) is an English former sportsman who played both <a href="association%20football">football</a> and <a href="cricket">cricket</a> during the 1950s, '60s and '70s.
Football career.
Born in <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a>, Mitten played as a <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">left winger</a> for <a href="Mansfield%20Town%20F.C.">Mansfield Town</a>, <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a>, <a href="Leicester%20City%20F.C.">Leicester City</a>, <a href="Coventry%20City%20F.C.">Coventry City</a>, <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a>, <a href="Exeter%20City%20F.C.">Exeter City</a>, <a href="Bath%20City%20F.C.">Bath City</a> and <a href="Trowbridge%20Town%20F.C.">Trowbridge Town</a>, making 203 appearances in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a>. After retiring as a player, Mitten became a manager, and was in charge of <a href="Tiverton%20Town%20F.C.">Tiverton Town</a> and Sidmouth Town.
He is the son of fellow footballer <a href="Charlie%20Mitten">Charlie Mitten</a>.
Cricket career.
He was active from 1958 to 1963 for <a href="Leicestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Leicestershire</a>. He appeared in 14 first-class matches as a right-handed <a href="batting%20%28cricket%29">batsman</a> who <a href="wicketkeeper">kept wicket</a>. He scored 259 <a href="run%20%28cricket%29">runs</a> with a highest score of 50<a href="not%20out">*</a> and completed 23 catches.
